You have come to the right place. All the ladies here are wonderful and I'm sure will have many words of wisdom and hope and encouragement for you. Please be gentle to yourself and don't borrow trouble. Lots of hugs to you

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2013 03:11PM Scaredandworried wrote: Hi flower such great news! I got the diagnosis of Alh after excisional biopsy in April this year and the path report said minute focus. I had been wondering since then if I should have someone re read my slides hoping that they'll tell me there's no ALH and that the first report was not correct. I know wishful thinking but your story gives me so much hope! Wondering if anyone else has had a similar experience. It's interesting that they still had your slides after all these years....I thought I was already late for a re read after a couple of months

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2017 06:13PM Scaredandworried wrote: So over the last one week, I've felt my breast around a lot more and I feel the lump is movable vs. what I had established as non movable before. I also forgot to mention that my nipple on the same breast seems like it's retracting from one side when I let my breast hang forward (when I bend down). Reading through some of the retracted nipples mentioned in other posts, I'm more and more convinced that this is not good at all. Really scared beyond words now!! I don't have my appointment till after I get back from my two week vacation that starts this coming sunday, which means I have to live with the anxiety till then. I feel like all symptoms are pointing to not good outcome which was the reason I pushed my appointment to after my trip :(
